trustfund:
TF037029-LAC REGION - HEALTH FOR COSTA
            RICA, HONDURAS, NICARAGUA, BRAZIL,TF029595-PHRD-HEALTH SECTOR REFORM PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Indigenous Peoples Development Plan
            describes how the project should be designed to reach the
            poor and indigenous people within a framework that is
            socially and financially sustainable. The Indigenous
            Profiles systematically identify the areas populated by
            indigenous peoples and African descendent communities,
            particularly their expectations regarding health. During the
            last few years, the government had undertaken three
            important initiatives in which indigenous peoples were
            consulted on health issues. The main health problems they
            considered priority are: respiratory infections, parasitic
            infections, and HIV/AIDS. Considered less common are mental
            disorders, occupational accidents, malaria, and dengue.
            Also, there are elevated rates of child malnutrition,
            although not fully accounted by the African descendants in
            the country's Caribbean region. Child mortality and
            maternal mortality are also high and associated with low
            sexual and reproductive health and limited access to health
            services. Institutional weaknesses and low quality of
            service were also problems. Finally, environmental
            degradation, and land and water contamination lead to high
            levels of diarrhea and a high incidence of dehydrated
            children and to death. An integral part of the strategy for
            local participation will include periodic participatory
            assessments of benefits reaching indigenous African
            descendent communities and subprojects supporting
            subcontracting with local nongovernmental organizations.
